snippet: A study in Finland concluded that men and women living alone were more likely to die of liver disease, alcohol poisoning, alcohol-related violence or accidents.
lead_paragraph: A study in Finland concluded that men and women living alone were more likely to die of liver disease, alcohol poisoning, alcohol-related violence or accidents.

headline.main: Risks: Alcohol Deaths and the Solo Life
headline.print_headline: Risks: Alcohol Deaths and the Solo Life
headline.seo: Living Alone Raises Risk of Alcohol Death, Study Says
